document.heading: Hearing Aid Dealers and Consumer Act of 1977

history.narrative: Law 2-33, the “Hearing Aid Dealers and Consumer Act of 1977,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-39, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 12, 1977 and July 26, 1977, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 17, 1977, it was assigned Act No. 2-79 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
